alert.note: Alert for Eastern Clay; Eastern Putnam; Inland St. Johns (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 5:59PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern St. Johns, northeastern Putnam and east central Clay Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 558 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing strong winds and possibly a waterspout over the St. Johns River near Hastings, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. Waterspouts possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Palatka, Hastings, East Palatka, World Golf Village, Bostwick, Federal Point, Orange Mills, Picolata, Spuds and Bakersville. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. For boaters on or near the St Johns River or Intracoastal waterway, move to a safe shelter now! Do not be caught on or near the water. Gusty winds and choppy waves are likely. Make sure all on board are wearing life jackets.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Clay; Eastern Putnam; Inland St. Johns
